title: Accept Aid

properties.name: description
properties.value: Accept Aid is a button under the Settings menu that lets other players cast teleother spells and Vengeance spells on the targeted player. While in a waiting room for Barbarian Assault, it allows players to receive recruitment requests. It mostly only useful in members worlds as there is no situation in which aid can be offered in free-to-play, with the exception of Christmas crackers. Ironmen can't enable Accept Aid.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Accept Aid
"Aid" redirects here. For the sequel to In Search of the Myreque, see In Aid of the Myreque. However, for the ring to harm vampyres, see Efaritay's aid.

Accept Aid is a button under the Settings menu that lets other players cast teleother spells and Vengeance spells on the targeted player. While in a waiting room for Barbarian Assault, it allows players to receive recruitment requests. It mostly only useful in members worlds as there is no situation in which aid can be offered in free-to-play, with the exception of Christmas crackers. Ironmen can't enable Accept Aid.

If the option is on, the player can be distracted by tele-other attempts at awkward times, such as during difficult combat, so it is safer to leave accept aid off unless with trusted friends. Also, tele-other can be used for luring.

Accept Aid is temporarily turned off during cutscenes and transitions.

See also[edit | edit source]

  • Options screen

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Attempting to enable Accept Aid as an Ironmen results in the message "Iron Men do not accept aid." to be displayed in the chat log.
rawContent:
{{External|rs}}
{{Redirect2|Aid|the sequel to [[In Search of the Myreque]]|In Aid of the Myreque|the ring to harm [[vampyres]]|Efaritay's aid}}
[[File:Toggle Accept aid.png|left]]
'''Accept Aid''' is a button under the [[Settings]] menu that lets other players cast [[Teleportation#Teleother|teleother]] spells and [[Vengeance]] spells on the targeted player. While in a waiting room for [[Barbarian Assault]], it allows players to receive recruitment requests. It mostly only useful in [[members]] worlds as there is no situation in which aid can be offered in [[free-to-play]], with the exception of [[Christmas cracker]]s. [[Ironmen]] can't enable Accept Aid.

If the option is on, the player can be distracted by tele-other attempts at awkward times, such as during difficult [[combat]], so it is safer to leave accept aid off unless with trusted friends. Also, tele-other can be used for [[luring]].

Accept Aid is temporarily turned off during cutscenes and transitions.

==See also==
* [[Options screen]]

==Trivia==

*Attempting to enable Accept Aid as an Ironmen results in the message "Iron Men do not accept aid." to be displayed in the chat log.
